Represents an image view in the item

AFSCME Child Care Providers Together is the union for Oregon\'s family child care providers. We know Oregon doesn\'t work without child care, and we connect families with union child care providers across Oregon. Families choose to find child care through AFSCME-CCPT because our member providers offer high-quality, developmentally appropriate, affordable care. When providers join us, they don\'t just enjoy the benefits of joining a union — they join a network of union families across the state.

"I am Registered family daycare which allows me to care for a maximum of 10 children. I am a member of Oregon Child Care Providers Together because it is smaller family child care homes that provide specialized and individualized care, who need to be supported so we can grow our business or feel supported as a business owner."

"We call our program, not a daycare, not a business but our labor of love. Love is the main reason why we do what we do. Our goal is not only to be the child care providers but to be like a second family to our children. We joined the union because in difficult times we know they have our backs!"

"Our certified family facility provides 24/7 care for infants, toddlers, preschoolers and school-aged children. We work hard to meet families needs and the needs of the children we care for. The union provides many training sessions, free to our members, so we and our staff can meet our training requirements to remain licensed and to always be improving our quality of care."
BECOME A UNION CHILD CARE PROVIDER
Learn more about how being part of Oregon Child Care Providers Together family helps to you and the families you care for. Because we know Oregon does it work with all of us!
REGISTERED FAMILY & CERTIFIED FAMILY LICENSED PROVIDERS\nJOIN OUR UNION

From promotion of your program to other union members and the general public looking for high-quality in-home care.

• Voice to improve the licensed exempt family child care profession over the state of Oregon.
• Free trainings you can do at home, or later to grow your program, see your professional education to yourself.
• Access to a free college program to credentialize for you and your partners.
• Free course Register of competence in serving a family child care program.
• Free and discounted services such as legal services, accidental insurance, and health services, and much more.
• Union representation wrestling with you for your rights.
LICENSED & LOCAL PROVIDERS - JOIN OUR UNION

"When you are a provider, it is easy to feel alone, we don\'t know who to trust or turn to for help. With our union, we have each other\'s backs and a community we can count on. It has been so helpful to have that support system that we can rely on for help and we know they have our interests at heart."

"The union has created a space for us to learn, grow, and stay connected to other providers. We are no longer working in isolation but as a united group, working to make things better for providers, kids, and families in our communities. I have grown so much as a provider and a person thanks to our union!"

"I am Registered Family provider who also care for my own children with autism. As a member of Oregon Child Care Providers Together because it is single-handedly what is making the profession more professional and with our union behind me, I get paid for the recognizes the importance of the hard work I put into my child care business."
Keep your information current in our public child care provider directory.

• Sign up for free trainings you can do at home on how to grow your program, run your business and advocate for yourself • Access to scholarship funds for professional development including college courses • Connect with free and discounted services • Your Provider Bill of Rights
Know other providers who should join AFSCME? SHARE this page with your Facebook friends.

Visit our local’s website: http://oregonccpt.com/\n\nWe have people available to answer any questions you may have about your union membership. Contact our Member Services Center at 1-844-758-6466 or MSC@oregonafscme.org
